instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V35_S3: What is PP1V35_S3? PP1V35_S3 is a 1.35v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.DDRREG_EN: What is DDRREG_EN? DDRREG_EN is an enable signal that turns on power rails for DDR memory.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> RAM Beep. Missing <SIGNAL>PP1V35_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hi Guys,

Got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that was liquid damaged. Fixed this and was working fine but it's come back a month later with a beeping RAM issue. Checked voltages and I get all main power rails and machine in S0 state except I'm missing  <SIGNAL>PP1V35_S3</SIGNAL> (0V). 

My <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> readings are as follows and can't see anything obvious blown there but I've never diagnosed any problems on this circuit yet:
[TABLE="border: 0, cellpadding: 0, cellspacing: 0"]
[TR]
[TD="width: 64"]Pin[/TD]
 			[TD="width: 91"]Voltage[/TD]
 			[TD="width: 281"]Power Rail[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]1[/TD]
 			[TD]0[/TD]
 			[TD]<SIGNAL>DDREG_VTTSNS</SIGNAL>[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]2[/TD]
 			[TD]0[/TD]
 			[TD]<SIGNAL>PP1V53_S3</SIGNAL>[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]3[/TD]
 			[TD]0[/TD]
 			[TD]<SIGNAL>PP0V675_S0_DDRVTT</SIGNAL>[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]4[/TD]
 			[TD]0[/TD]
 			[TD]GND[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]5[/TD]
 			[TD]0[/TD]
 			[TD]<SIGNAL>PPVTTRRD3_S3</SIGNAL>[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]6[/TD]
 			[TD]1.8[/TD]
 			[TD]<SIGNAL>DDREG_1V8_VREF</SIGNAL>[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]7[/TD]
 			[TD]0[/TD]
 			[TD]GND[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]8[/TD]
 			[TD]1.3[/TD]
 			[TD]<SIGNAL>DDRREG_FB</SIGNAL>[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]9[/TD]
 			[TD]0[/TD]
 			[TD]<SIGNAL>DDRREG_VDDQSNS</SIGNAL>[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]10[/TD]
 			[TD]0[/TD]
 			[TD]GND[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]11[/TD]
 			[TD]0[/TD]
 			[TD]<SIGNAL>DDREG_DRVL</SIGNAL>[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]12[/TD]
 			[TD]5[/TD]
 			[TD]<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL>[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]13[/TD]
 			[TD]0[/TD]
 			[TD]<SIGNAL>DDRREG_LL</SIGNAL>[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]14[/TD]
 			[TD]0[/TD]
 			[TD]<SIGNAL>DDRREG_DRVH</SIGNAL>[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]15[/TD]
 			[TD]5[/TD]
 			[TD]<SIGNAL>DDRREG_VBST</SIGNAL>[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]16[/TD]
 			[TD]3.3[/TD]
 			[TD]<SIGNAL>DDRREG_EN</SIGNAL>[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]17[/TD]
 			[TD]3.2[/TD]
 			[TD]<SIGNAL>MEMVTT_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]18[/TD]
 			[TD]0.5[/TD]
 			[TD]<SIGNAL>DDRREG_TRIP</SIGNAL>[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]19[/TD]
 			[TD]0[/TD]
 			[TD]<SIGNAL>DDRREG_MODE</SIGNAL>[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]20[/TD]
 			[TD]0.027[/TD]
 			[TD]<SIGNAL>DDRREG_PGOOD</SIGNAL>[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[/TABLE]


Any help would be appreciated on whether I'm missing any signals to the chip (I don't have a known good board to check against) and how to best troubleshoot further?

Thanks,

Jon

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> RAM Beep. Missing <SIGNAL>PP1V35_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Most likely corroded trace or resistor around <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>. Most likely are <RESISTOR>R7425</RESISTOR>+traces and pin 2 and 12 on <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>. Could be dead <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> too, but I doubt it would have worked at all.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> RAM Beep. Missing <SIGNAL>PP1V35_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message: <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> area looks good but saw slight red area indicating burn on pin 1 of <RESISTOR>R7425</RESISTOR>, <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> traces look good but will check all of them with the multimeter to be sure. Replaced <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>, <RESISTOR>R7425</RESISTOR> & <CAPACITOR>C7425</CAPACITOR> - no change. Resistors in that area all measure good. Could it be something on the 1.35V side of the circuit - bad RAM chip or capacitor etc?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> RAM Beep. Missing <SIGNAL>PP1V35_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Unless there is a short on the 1V35 line it should come high. The enable is present so it must work. Checked traces to <RESISTOR>R7425</RESISTOR>/<CAPACITOR>C7425</CAPACITOR>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> RAM Beep. Missing <SIGNAL>PP1V35_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Have same issue with  <SIGNAL>PP1V35_S3</SIGNAL> ,I think is shorted somewhere but nothing get hot
